CyOB functions¶

This section explains in detail what happens inside the CyOB functions. It is not needed to fully understand this in order to work with CyOB.

Warning

This section is only meant to give extra information. It is not recommended to change the source code.

CyOB.handler(input_dict)¶

The main handler for Cython Orbital Builder. Takes the information from the input dictionary to determine what functions to call.

CyOB.validity_check(input_dict)¶

Function in order to check whether the given input dictionary is valid.

Exits the program if a formatting error is found. Returns True if the dictionary is valid.

Parameters:input_dict – The input dictionary.
CyOB.calculate_molecule(name, atoms, basis)¶

Function for performing the Hartree-Fock calculations on the molecule using the PyQInt package.

Outputs the contracted Gaussian basis functions and the orbital coefficients.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the molecule (str).
  • atoms – The list of atom tuples.
  • basis – The basis set (str).
CyOB.tesselate(cgfs, coeff, isovalue=0.01)¶

Function for building isosurfaces (tessellation) of the given orbital, using the PyTessel and PyQInt packages.

Outputs arrays for the vertices, normals and indices (faces).

Parameters:
  • cgfs – Contracted Gaussion basis functions of the molecule.
  • coeff – Coefficients of the desired molecular orbital (list).
  • isovalue – The desired isovalue (float or int, standard is 0.01).
CyOB.tesselate_all(cgfs, coeff, isovalue=0.01)¶

Function for creating a dictionaries for tessellated surfaces for all molecular orbitals. This increases the efficiency of CyOB.

Outputs a list with a dict per MO. The dicts contain information for the positive and negative lobes.

Parameters:
  • cgfs – Contracted Gaussion basis functions of the molecule.
  • coeff – Coefficients of the desired molecular orbital (list).
  • isovalue – The desired isovalue (float or int, standard is 0.01).
CyOB.single_polygon(filename, orbital_dict, pos_neg='positive')¶

Function for creating polygon files of a separate lobe of an orbital.

Parameters:
  • filename – Filename under which the created file will be saved (str, including suffix)
  • orbital_dict – Dictionary of the information of the desired molecular orbital as created by CyOB.tesselate_all().
  • pos_neg – Flag to determine whether the positive- or negative lobe has to be made into a polygon file ('positive' or 'negative')
CyOB.double_polygon(filename, orbital_dict)¶

Function for creating polygon files of a both lobe of an orbital. Vertices, normals and indices are combined before creating the file.

Parameters:
  • filename – Filename under which the created file will be saved (str, including suffix)
  • orbital_dict – Dictionary of the information of the desired molecular orbital as created by:py:func:CyOB.tesselate_all.
CyOB.build_abo(orbital_info, name, atoms, basis)¶

Function for building the file to be opened in Managlyph (.abo).

Parameters:
  • orbital_list – List of dictionaries containing the information about the molecular orbitals, as created by CyOB.tesselate_all().
  • name – The name of the molecule, used to determine the name of the file (str).
  • atoms – The list of atom tuples.
  • basis – The basis set (str).
CyOB.make_plots(cgfs, coeff, name)¶

Function for creating the contour plots of the orbitals using the PyQInt package.

Parameters:
  • cgfs – Contracted Gaussion gasis functions of the molecule.
  • coeff – Coefficients of the desired molecular orbital (list).
  • name – The name of the molecule, used to determine the name of the files (str).
